definition: to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: If Detroit gets money, then everyone would have a case.
sentences.chinese: 如果底特律得偿所愿，那么每个人都会有一套说辞。

sentences.english: Yet this is all just rhetoric.
sentences.chinese: 然而，所有这些不过是说辞而已。

sentences.english: Should America and Europe abandon any pretense of even wanting to promote democracy abroad?
sentences.chinese: 美国和欧洲抑或应该放弃任何在海外推动民主的说辞？

sentences.english: Well, this is hugely stereotypical, hugely appropriative.
sentences.chinese: 这是个非常明显的他固有的老套说辞。

sentences.english: What terms shall we find which have not been already exhausted?
sentences.chinese: 我们还能找到什么尚未用尽的说辞呢？

sentences.english: It was a pretty convincing speech, I thought.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这是一个极有说服力的演说辞。

sentences.english: We don't think the president himself composed the speech.
sentences.chinese: 我们不认为是总统本人写的演说辞。

sentences.english: It could just as well apply to a racketeer or a thief who robs you.
sentences.chinese: 这套说辞对骗子和窃贼同样适用。

sentences.english: First, you’ll need to practice your speech.
sentences.chinese: 首先，你需要实际演练你的演讲说辞。

sentences.english: Frank was about to sign the loan papers when the bank began to whistle a different tune.
sentences.chinese: 当法兰克要签贷款合约的时候，银行就换另一种说辞。

sentences.english: He has recorded whole speeches, but miniature one.
sentences.chinese: 他把全部演说辞收录在案，但是又简化它。

sentences.english: Sen. Obama dedicated a large portion of his speech to retelling Sen. Biden's personal story.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马在演说辞中花了大量篇幅介绍拜登的个人经历。

sentences.english: Now you don't have to be dealing with classic American oratory to run into problems.
sentences.chinese: 现在你没有必要为美国经典演说辞而苦恼。

definition: polite phrase/conventional greetings/cliché/to try to worm facts out of sb
to muddle through/to fob sb off/to beat around the bush/to dodge
to use as an excuse/on the pretext/excuse/pretext
to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
